case.name: Fair Recruitment AI System
case.description: An assurance case demonstrating that an AI-powered recruitment system operates fairly and without discrimination in the hiring process.

tree.name: G1
tree.description: The AI recruitment system makes fair and non-discriminatory hiring recommendations.
context: Fairness is defined according to UK Equality Act 2010 protected characteristics (age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage, pregnancy, race, religion, sex, and sexual orientation).
The system processes 10,000+ applications monthly for entry-level software engineering positions in a context where diversity and inclusion are strategic priorities.

children.name: S1
children.description: Demonstrate fairness through discrimination prevention mechanisms and effective mitigation strategies implemented throughout the AI system's lifecycle.

children.name: P1
children.description: The training dataset has been audited and balanced to ensure representation across all demographic groups and cleansed of historically discriminatory patterns.

children.name: E1
children.description: Audit report detailing demographic breakdown of 50,000 candidate profiles, demonstrating balanced representation across protected characteristics.

children.name: P2
children.description: Statistical testing demonstrates that the AI system's recommendations show no disparate impact or treatment across protected characteristic groups.

children.name: E2
children.description: Statistical analysis showing demographic parity, equalised odds, and calibration metrics across protected groups, demonstrating no significant discrimination.

children.name: S2
children.description: Establish fairness by ensuring the AI system's decisions are transparent and explainable to candidates and hiring managers, enabling scrutiny of potentially discriminatory outcomes.

children.name: P3
children.description: Every AI recommendation is accompanied by a human-readable explanation detailing the key factors, enabling hiring managers to verify the rationale.

children.name: E3
children.description: Documentation of explanation system with examples and user study results showing 85% comprehension rate among hiring managers and candidates.

children.name: P4
children.description: A formal appeals process allows candidates to challenge AI decisions and request human review, ensuring meaningful oversight and error correction.

children.name: E4
children.description: Appeals procedure documentation showing 100% of appeals receive human review within 72 hours, with 15% overturn rate indicating effective oversight.

children.name: S3
children.description: Maintain fairness through ongoing monitoring of system performance across demographic groups, with regular audits and updates to address emerging discrimination.
